comments.text:
All those streets no longer exist - they were scheduled to be demolished 
but it was held up until filming was wrapped up for this film. The site 
would soon become "Lincoln Center."﻿

comments.text:
WEST SIDE STORY
The opening Prologue from the 10-time Academy Award winning musical film 
West Side Story, which is celebrating its 50th Anniversary on November 15, 
2011. Here is the full Prologue from the movie in HD, and below are links 
where you purchase the 50th Anniversary Edition of West Side Story on 
Blu-ray and Limited 

Conceived, Directed and Choreographed by Jerome Robbins
Music by Leonard Bernstein
Lyrics by Stephen Sondheim
Book by Arthur Laurents

Programa
Just Dance

Actores
Natalie Wood Richard Beymer Russ Tamblyn Rita Moreno George Chakiris Simon 
Oakland Ned Glass William Bramley Tucker Smith Tony Mordente David Winters 
Eliot Feld Bert Michaels David Bean Robert Banas Anthony 'Scooter' Teague 
Harvey Evans Tommy Abbott Susan Oakes Gina Trikonis
Director
Jerome Robbins
Productor
DanceOn
Guionistas
Arthur Laurents Leonard Bernstein Stephen Sondheim
Categoría﻿
comments.author: Donato De Nicola. Vitae Dolor

comments.text: Like if you're still watching this in 2015!﻿
comments.author: Adam B

comments.text:
Saw this as a kid when it was first released. Doesn't it seem strange to 
see tough gang members doing ballet moves on each other. Also there was a 
lot of work put into this opening scene and it still looks like mayhem. 
They seem to running around the same four streets and there are no other 
people in sight. An uninhabited New York﻿
comments.author: alg11297

comments.text:
forgetting something?  this is a fictional movie based on actual 
stereotypical representation of racial tension.  it is not meant to be 
taken so literally!  I was a kid, and I'm Italian- but I loved George 
Chakiris after this movie for years - collected every single picture in 
every single magazine ...and then he disappeared from the film industry. it 
was fun while it lasted though
comments.author: sunshinenblues

comments.author: Teenage Lawyer

comments.text: この映画が作られたのが1961年、今から53年も前である。大学生であったが日比谷の映画館で観たが、最後まで目を離すことが出来なかった。アメリカのショウビジネスの凄さを思い知らされて、息をすることさえ忘れていた。53年も昔に制作した傑作だが、逆に今、同じ様に出来るだろうか。NOだろうと、言って仕舞うのは私だけではないだろうと思う。﻿
comments.author: SpaceRuler

music scores in movie history. Always mesmerizing, never gets old.﻿

comments.text:
Genius composer + genius choreographer + genius set designer and amazing 
cast.  Possibly one of the greatest musicals ever made.  Eternal story, but 
certainly dated by today's standards of gang low-lifes, drugs, high powered 
weapons, and bottom feeders who place them back on the street.﻿

comments.author: Mark Armstrong

comments.text:
This is it! Number 1 on my list of best/favorite movies of all time. I'll 
be a Jet, I'll be a Shark, I'll be officer Krupke --- just want to be part 
of this fantastic film that I've loved since watching it on the ABC Monday 
Night Movies when I was about 9 or 10 (I was born in 1961-the year this 
film was released).  FYI: my #2 choice was also released in 1961, Breakfast 
at Tiffany's (#3 is To Kill a Mockingbird!).﻿

comments.text:
KJV-Matthew//マタイによる福音書6:22-23
The light of the body is the eye:
if therefore thine eye be single,
thy whole body shall be full of light.
目はからだのあかりである。
だから、あなたの目が澄んでおれば、
全身も明るいだろう。 
But if thine eye be evil, thy whole body shall be full of darkness.
If therefore the light that is in thee be darkness,
how great is that darkness!
しかし、あなたの目が悪ければ、全身も暗いだろう。
だから、もしあなたの内なる光が暗ければ、
その暗さは、どんなであろう。

Aamen.

 ﻿

comments.text:
É stato e rimane il più bel film musicale che abbia mai visto e che abbia 
amato fin dalla prima uscita ... meravigliosa la musica, i balletti, gli 
attori e tutto il resto. Credo d`averlo visto più di 40 volte tra sale 
cinematografiche, TV e dvd e non mi stanco mai di rivederlo. Buona visione 
a chi non l`ha mai visto ! ﻿
